note: Prototype data model. Replace the placeholder teams, records, and scenarios with the real CFP 1-12 each week. Bracket and team pages will update automatically from this file.

scenarios.bestCase: Win remaining regular season + conference title; enter CFP as clear #1 with favorable semifinal matchup.
scenarios.mostLikely: Win conference title game, remain in top 2; national championship run depends on semifinal matchup.
scenarios.worstCase: Lose conference title; fall to #3-#4, potentially face toughest possible semifinal opponent.

schedule.label: CFP Semifinal
schedule.note: Opponent depends on final CFP ranking.

teams.name: Team Two
teams.projection: Tracking for a top-2 seed with a conference title win.

scenarios.bestCase: Win conference and finish #1 or #2 with strong momentum into the playoff.
scenarios.mostLikely: Split remaining games, finish between #2 and #3.
scenarios.worstCase: Drop conference title + bad loss; tumble to #4 or barely remain inside top 4.

teams.name: Team Three
teams.projection: Firmly in the mix but needs help for a top-2 seed.

scenarios.bestCase: Win out + chaos above; sneak into #1 or #2 if others stumble.
scenarios.mostLikely: Finish between #3 and #4 with one more tight win.
scenarios.worstCase: Close loss in title game; slide to #5 if committee favors another champ.

schedule.label: Conference Championship
schedule.note: Committee will judge margin of victory heavily.

teams.name: Team Four
teams.projection: Controls its own destiny for the last CFP spot.

scenarios.bestCase: Win out and take conference; could rise as high as #2 with strong results.
scenarios.mostLikely: Win conference in a close game; stay at #4.
scenarios.worstCase: Lose again and fall to #7+; outside looking in.

teams.name: Team Five
teams.projection: First in line to crash the party if someone slips.

scenarios.bestCase: Convincing title win + chaos above; jumps into #4.
scenarios.mostLikely: Finishes just outside the top 4 and heads to a NY6 bowl.
scenarios.worstCase: Loss knocks them into lower NY6 / at-large territory.

teams.name: Team Six
teams.projection: NY6 lock with an outside CFP shot.

scenarios.bestCase: Win out + upsets in other leagues; squeaks into #4.
scenarios.worstCase: Could fall to #10–#12 with another loss.

teams.name: Team Seven
teams.projection: Needs a wild championship weekend for CFP consideration.

scenarios.bestCase: Upset Team Two in conference title + chaos elsewhere; fringe CFP argument.
scenarios.mostLikely: Ends between #7 and #9 with a strong NY6 slot.
scenarios.worstCase: Another loss drops them to lower top-15.

teams.name: Team Eight
teams.projection: Playing spoiler to Team Four’s CFP hopes.

scenarios.bestCase: Win out; could climb into top-6 and lock a NY6 bowl.
scenarios.worstCase: Loss plus chaos drops them to #12 or lower.

teams.name: Team Nine
teams.projection: Underdog in conference title game vs Team One.

scenarios.bestCase: Shock upset over Team One vaults them into top-6.
scenarios.mostLikely: Competitive loss keeps them in top-10.
scenarios.worstCase: Blowout loss + other results drop them to #12.

scenarios.bestCase: Upset Team Three and climb into #7–#8.
scenarios.worstCase: Could fall out of top-12 with another loss.

scenarios.bestCase: Big ranked win plus chaos; sneaks up to #8–#9.
scenarios.worstCase: Loss or bad performance drops them out of the final 12.

teams.name: Team Twelve
teams.projection: Hanging on to the last top-12 slot.

scenarios.bestCase: Signature win over ranked opponent; climbs to #10.
scenarios.worstCase: Any loss likely pushes them out of the final 12.
